hw2

Class Set

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw2.Set

  • public class Set
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulates and scores a set of tennis with two players, player0 and player 1 alternating the role of server.
    Author:
    Max

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Set(int minimumGamesToWin, boolean player1ServesFirst)
      Constructs a set of tennis games with a desired number of games required to win, and says who will serve first.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fastForward(int serverScore, int receiverScore)
      Fast forwards the game to a future point with given scores for the server and receiver.
      java.lang.String getCurrentStatus(boolean useCallString)
      Returns the score of the game based on a series of rules dictating whether to return raw score or using the tennis scoring conventions
      void hit(boolean fault, boolean outOfBounds)
      Simulates a hit and keeps track of the games won provided the hit ends the current game.
      boolean isCurrentGameOver()
      Checks whether or not the current tennis game is over
      boolean isSetOver()
      Checks if the set is over using the required minimum games to win
      void miss()
      Simulates a miss by the player the ball is headed towards and keeps track of games won provided the action of missing ends the current game
      void newGame()
      Creates a new game provided the current game is over and the set is not over.
      int player0GamesWon()
      Returns the number of games won by player0 in the set
      int player1GamesWon()
      Returns the number of games won by player1 in the set
      void serve(boolean serviceFault)
      Simulates a serve and keeps track of the games won provided the serve ends the current game.
      int whoIsServing()
      Tests which player is serving the ball at the moment

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Set

        public Set(int minimumGamesToWin,
           boolean player1ServesFirst)
        Constructs a set of tennis games with a desired number of games required to win, and says who will serve first.
        Parameters:
        minimumGamesToWin - sets the number of tennis games required to win the set
        player1ServesFirst - says if player1 will serve first

    • Method Detail

      • serve

        public void serve(boolean serviceFault)
        Simulates a serve and keeps track of the games won provided the serve ends the current game.
        Parameters:
        serviceFault - dictates whether or not the server faulted on their serve

      • hit

        public void hit(boolean fault,
                boolean outOfBounds)
        Simulates a hit and keeps track of the games won provided the hit ends the current game.
        Parameters:
        fault - dictates if the hitter faulted on their hit
        outOfBounds - says whether or not the ball is headed out of bounds as a result of the hit

      • miss

        public void miss()
        Simulates a miss by the player the ball is headed towards and keeps track of games won provided the action of missing ends the current game

      • fastForward

        public void fastForward(int serverScore,
                        int receiverScore)
        Fast forwards the game to a future point with given scores for the server and receiver.
        Parameters:
        serverScore - how many points the server will have scored
        receiverScore - how many points the receiver will have scored

      • newGame

        public void newGame()
        Creates a new game provided the current game is over and the set is not over.

      • isCurrentGameOver

        public boolean isCurrentGameOver()
        Checks whether or not the current tennis game is over
        Returns:
        true if the current game is over, false if not

      • isSetOver

        public boolean isSetOver()
        Checks if the set is over using the required minimum games to win
        Returns:
        true if set is over, false if it is not

      • getCurrentStatus

        public java.lang.String getCurrentStatus(boolean useCallString)
        Returns the score of the game based on a series of rules dictating whether to return raw score or using the tennis scoring conventions
        Parameters:
        useCallString - says whether or not the string should return using tennis scoring conventions
        Returns:
        a string showing set score and current/last game score.

      • whoIsServing

        public int whoIsServing()
        Tests which player is serving the ball at the moment
        Returns:
        0 if player0 is serving, 1 if player1 is serving

      • player0GamesWon

        public int player0GamesWon()
        Returns the number of games won by player0 in the set
        Returns:
        an integer value for number of games won by player0

      • player1GamesWon

        public int player1GamesWon()
        Returns the number of games won by player1 in the set
        Returns:
        an integer value for number of games won by player1
